content: Over time the rate of media mergers has increased, while the number of media outlets has also increased. This has resulted in a higher concentration of ownership, with fewer companies owning more media outlets.

title: In 1983, 90% of US media was controlled by fifty companies; today, 90% is controlled by just six companies.
